detail.content: The Art of Mixing: Tisch School of the Arts at NYU                           Skip to content        Recorded Music Program Courses Internships News & Events Facilities Alumni Faculty Directory Recorded Music FAQs For High School Students Facebook Twitter YouTube Summer In Recorded Music Academic Advisement Resources 194 Recordings  home > Recorded Music        The Art of Mixing  REMU-UT.1701 Production 2 Credits Instructor(s): Staff Pre-requisites: REMU-UT 1003 Producing the Record: Side B, with a grade of C or better. Note: There is a lab fee for this course. Mixing a record can be defined in its most basic form as taking the musical elements that the artist and producer have recorded and making it sound fantastic. Easier said than done, as: 1) everyone’s idea of sounds great is different, 2) the mix must, at all costs, work toward realization of the artist and producer’s intent of the vibe of the track, and 3) our skills at constructing sonic masterpieces are always a work-in-progress. In this course, students will dissect and examine the myriad issues that must be addressed when mixing a record. As necessitated by the ever-increasing complexity of digital recording techniques, students will also study and develop methods of logistics and organization, including ProTools sessions, documentation, data management, and backup/archiving. Finally, the course will examine the human factors that are a facet of everyday life as a working professional, and how they relate to artists, bands, producers, studio personnel, management, record labels, session protocol, and care and feeding of the mixer – you! Sound Mix Workshop: Tisch School of the Arts at NYU                           Skip to content        Undergraduate Film & Television Admissions About the Program Course Offerings Summer Courses Showcase Internships Facilities Special Projects First Run & Festivals Calendar of Events News TSOA FTV Wiki Admin & Faculty Alumni Blog Facebook Twitter YouTube  home > Undergraduate Film & TV        Sound Mix Workshop  H56.1010 Lecture 3 Credits Course Level: Intermediate/Advanced    Prerequisites: Sound Image, two of the three Sight and Sound Fundamental courses.    This class will provide students with an understanding of the process leading up to the final mix of a Film/TV project. If you are interested in becoming a mixer, this will be an opportunity to learn the inner workings of a studio, while getting hands-on experience in a professional setting: our mix studio. For directors/editors/writers/producers or anyone involved with the learning process of making and finishing a Film/TV project, this will be just as valuable for communicating with your personnel. An excellent next step for those who have taken Sound Design I.
